The Scripting Language¶

This section describes the scripting language used to specify the system to simulate.

Using the scripting language, you can do the following:

  • Set the value of parameters and variables

  • Specify the sequence of stimuli to present to the subject

  • Run the simulation to produce simulation data

  • Plot or export the simulation data

Parameters¶

In order to run a simulation, a number of parameters must be specified. For example, to set the parameter beta to the value 0.4, use:

beta: 0.4

Below follows a description of each of the available parameters in Learning Simulator·

All parameters can be found in the tables below, one table for parameters that control the simulation, and one for the parameters used in the postprocessing. The tables also specify the default value of each parameter, or of it is required. In the tables, \(E\) stands for a stimulus element, and \(B\) for a behavior.

E1->B1:val1, …, En->Bn:valn, default:val

Simulation parameters

Parameter

Default/ Required

Possible values

Example

alpha_v

List of stimulus element values
0.8
S1:1, S2:2, default:0

press, walk_away

Scalar
List of behavior values
1.5
S1:1, S2:2, default:0

on
